alert.note: Alert for Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:58PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Shoal Creek at Shoal Creek Road near Griffin affecting Spalding County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Shoal Creek at Shoal Creek Road near Griffin. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins of the natural flood plain upstream and downstream from the gage on Shoal Creek Road. This will primarily affect woodlands and agricultural fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EST Tuesday was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.0 feet on 08/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
